name: Mashed Potatoes with Ham
description: This ham and mashed potatoes recipe evolved from scalloped potatoes, which are tasty but time-consuming to bake. Instead, I warmed up leftover mashed potatoes, then decided to throw in some ham to save a dish. The next time I made it, I added a cheese and crumb topping to give this casserole an appealing golden look. —Kathy Giesbrecht, Prespatou, British Columbia
recipeIngredient: 3-1/2 to 4 cups hot mashed potatoes (prepared with milk with butter)

recipeInstructions.text: In a large microwave-safe bowl, combine onion and 1 tablespoon of butter. Microwave, uncovered, on high for 2 minutes or until tender, stirring once. Add potatoes, ham, onion salt and pepper; mix well. Transfer to a greased 1-1/2-qt. baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese and cornflakes; dot with remaining butter. Bake, uncovered, at 375° for 15 minutes or until heated through.

review.reviewBody: This is delicious, and a great way to use leftovers! I sautèed the onion on the stove instead of microwaving it. I didn't use cornflakes for the topping. I combined 1 Tbsp melted butter and 1/4 cup breadcrumbs. I put the cheese on the top first, then I put on the buttered breadcrumbs. I didn't use cubed ham,  but I used the same amount. I cut and defatted some leftover sliced ham into small pieces and used those instead. I had used cream cheese and butter when I previously made the mashed potatoes, so they were still very creamy and worked well in this dish.
This recipe was very easy to make and tasted wonderful.  If you have leftover mashed potatoes this is a delicious way to use them up!
